question.text: Observe the below diagram. Identify the option suggesting the correct functions of A, B and C.

options.text: A: Helps in formation of vegetative cells and can regenerate into new individual by fragmentation, B: Helps in attachment to the substratum, C: Produces female gametes for sexual reproduction
A: Helps in formation of vegetative cells and can regenerate into new individual by fragmentation, B: Produces female gametes for sexual reproduction, C: Helps in attachment to the substratum
A: Produces female gametes for sexual reproduction, B: Help in formation of vegetative cells and can regenerate into new individual by fragmentation, C: Helps in attachment to the substratum
A: Produces female gametes for sexual reproduction, B: Helps in attachment to the substratum, C: Help in formation of vegetative cells and can regenerate into new individual by fragmentation

solution.text:
The given diagram is of female thallus of Marchantia.
A: Archegoniophore: Female branch containing female sex organ for production of female gamete and receiving the male gamete for sexual reproduction.
B: Gemma cups are structures which contain vegetative cells in them. These cells help the liverworts reproduce by vegetative propagation by fragmentation.
C: Rhizoids are root-like unicellular structures in liverworts which help in attachment to the substratum and at the same time help absorb water and minerals.
